intro: Pouzolzia weddellii var. weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's pouzolzia, is a shrub native to the southern hemisphere, particularly found in South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
